## **Description**
The **FormatDate **operator allows to change the format of an input date, by editing its settings.

## **Input**
**Input**

**Data type**

**Description**

**in0**

Date

The date for which you want to modify the format

## **Output**
**Output**

**Data type**

**Description**

**out0**

String

A string containing the date in the requested format

## **Settings**
**![](data:image/png;base64,)**

- From the **Input Format **drop-down menu, select the format of the input date.

- From the **Output Format **drop-down menu, select the format to use for the output date.

- From the **Input Locale **drop-down menu, select the language settings that the operator will use when interpreting the input date.

> Note

By selecting the "Default" option, the operator will use the language settings defined at runtime.

- From the **Output Locale **drop-down menu, select the preferred language settings that the operator will use when returning the output date.

> Note

By selecting the "Default" option, the operator will use the language settings defined at runtime.

- Click **Apply **to confirm.

> Tip

Click ![](data:image/png;base64,) (**Add item**) at the bottom of the drop-down menu to add a custom value to the list, then click ![](data:image/png;base64,) to confirm.

![](data:image/png;base64,)

## **Special cases**
In special cases, the operator behaves as follows:

**Case**

**Behavior**

**NULL input (no input)**

The operator returns an empty string.

**NULL input value**

The operator returns an empty string.
